column4: hey, is there any way to dualboot ubuntu desktop and ubuntu server?
so i can use the desktop and host my game server when im not using desktop
Do you realize that Ubuntu Desktop and Ubuntu server both use the same package repositories?
You can, I just don't see the use, since they are the same thing, just with different packages installed.
So you can turn off the service that provides the desktop environment.
how would i do that? im newish to  ubuntu.
sudo service gdm stop    or  start
and sudo server gdm start to re-enable the X?
restarting the computer would also re-enable the X right?
Because you didn't know what to type? or some other reason?
You should see a login screen in one of your ttys.
at ctrl-alt-f1 (f7 to return to your desktop)
its 'gdm' and only if you want to stop the graphical interface.
